name: Iidoe
description:
The Iidoe Institute is tipped to revolutionising the way in which Further Education is carried out; offering a concrete alternative to standard learning processes. 

The Institute of Iideo is the first high concept facility of its kind. The environment fosters a highly intensive Gamified learning experience like no other, aimed at providing individuals with a complete professional experience facilitated by ground-breaking gamification technology and real time feedback.

The main concept that runs throughout the Iidoe Institute from faculty members to students is creating a independent-minds that can operate as a team.

team.name: Iidoe Institute
team.bioHtml: Founder @The Iidoe Institute @Tiwa Williams @Daniel Steele

jobs.title: Cinematographer
jobs.description:
Company description

The Iidoe Institute is a training program that defines professional experience.

We provide simulated programs that replicate a real life internal working environment with individuals working within different jobs, together, alongside each other and against each other.

The environment fosters a highly intensive gamified learning experience like no other, aimed at providing individuals with a complete professional experience facilitated by ground-breaking gamification technology and real time feedback. 

We are seeking hungry, enthusiastic, expressive individuals that are ready for a role that offers responsibility, experience and a large degree of autonomy. The main concept that runs throughout the Iidoe Institute, from faculty members to students, is creating strong independent minds that are able to come together and operate as a team.

We are looking for someone to fill the role of Cinematographer.

Job duties 
We are looking for a Cinematographer who would be responsible for managing camera crews and lighting crews, and overseeing the selection and manipulation of technical equipment to create striking images on screen. The visual impact of a film is driven by the creative choices a cinematographer makes, as they are involved in the entire production process.

Assembling and setting up equipment 
Planning, preparing and rehearsing scenes
Following camera scripts
Creatively framing and capturing action
Responding quickly to directions
Liaising with lighting and technical staff

Job requirements
Bachelor's degree in relevant industry (eg.Film, Media, production) 
Digital camera and computer skills, artistic ability
A passion for film and expert knowledge of how to use cameras and other film-making equipment.
Creative skills and have a high level of attention to detail

Recruitment process
Respond and send us your CV
Skype interview with Human Resource Team
Face to face interview with Manager
Job Type: Contract, Internship

jobs.title: Creative Director
jobs.description:
Company description  
The Iidoe Institute is an immersive training program that defines professional experience.

We provide simulated programs that replicate a real life internal working environment with individuals working within different jobs, together, alongside each other and against each other.
The environment fosters a highly intensive gamified learning experience like no other, aimed at providing individuals with a complete professional experience facilitated by ground-breaking gamification technology and real time feedback. 

We are seeking hungry, enthusiastic, expressive individuals that are ready for a role that offers responsibility, experience and a large degree of autonomy. The main concept that runs throughout the Iidoe Institute, from faculty members to students, is creating strong independent minds that can come together and operate as a team.

We are looking for someone to fill the role of Creative Director.

Job duties
We are looking for creative director who will responsible for managing the creative vision and direction of our brand and our clients. You will be managing campaigns both digital and offline and also managing our in-house and external creative content. As well as creativity, strong managerial skills are an essential element of this position. You will collaborate with account executives to obtain knowledge of the clients’ requirements.
Direct and motivate teams of art directors, illustrators, copywriters etc. to help them use their talents effectively
Lead brainstorming/creative sessions to generate ideas
Write and design unique and well-crafted copy that meet clients’ needs as well as our own
Revise content and presentations, approve/reject ideas, provide feedback to the team
Train and guide subordinates into accomplished professionals
Monitor results of team efforts and propose actions for the future


Job requirements
A degree relative to the position e.g. Business, Marketing, Graphic Design, Business Management
Experience in working in job relative to the position e.g. manager, art director, graphic designer, motion designer etc.
Hand-on experience in creative process, marketing, graphic design and brand development
Excellent working knowledge of software such as Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign etc.
Outstanding leadership and organization skills

Recruitment processes
Respond and send us your CV. 
Skype interview with Human Resource Team
Face to face interview with Manager
Job Type: Contract, Iternship

jobs.title: HR
jobs.description:
Company description
The Iidoe Institute is a training program that defines professional experience.

We provide simulated programs that replicate a real life internal working environment with individuals working within different jobs, together, alongside each other and against each other.

The environment fosters a highly intensive gamified learning experience like no other, aimed at providing individuals with a complete professional experience facilitated by ground-breaking gamification technology and real time feedback. 

We are seeking hungry, enthusiastic, expressive individuals that are ready for a role that gives responsibility, experience and a large degree of autonomy. The main concept that runs throughout the Iidoe Institute, from faculty members to students, is creating strong independent minds that can come together and operate as a team.

Job requirements
Degree in Business Management or HR 
Worked in a similar role, administrative.
Interest in Human resources as a career 

Job duties
We are looking for an HR assistant to handle a variety of personnel related administrative duties. Your role is to act as the liaison between HR managers and employees, ensuring smooth communication and prompt resolution of all queries. They will be working alongside employees and managers. 
Administrative task, Creating and maintaining relevant documents about employees
Recruiting, hiring, and training new employees
Employee relations, build relationship with different stakeholders 
Maintaining computer system by updating and entering data
Compiling reports and spreadsheets and preparing spreadsheets
Working towards deadlines 

Recruitment process 
Respond and send us your CV

jobs.title: Operations manager
jobs.description:
Company description
The Iidoe Institute is a training program that defines professional experience.

We provide simulated programs that replicate a real life internal working environment with individuals working within different jobs, together, alongside each other and against each other.

The environment fosters a highly intensive gamified learning experience like no other, aimed at providing individuals with a complete professional experience facilitated by ground-breaking gamification technology and real time feedback. 
We are seeking hungry, enthusiastic, expressive individuals that are ready for a role that gives responsibility, experience and a large degree of autonomy. The main concept that runs throughout the Iidoe Institute, from faculty members to students, is creating strong independent minds that can come together and operate as a team.

We are looking for someone to fill the role as our Operations manager: 

Job requirements
Oversees the daily workings of business operations. Plans, manages, and implements schedules to ensure deadlines are met, and maintains a high-quality standard of product production and delivery.

Job duties
The daily responsibilities of an operations manager vary, but typically include:
Manages the growth and success of the team
Coordinates activities that affect operational decisions and business requirements
Responsible for the production, procurement, and planning of daily operations
Communicates with all relevant employees to ensure delivery times are met
Plans, schedules, and reviews workload and manpower to make sure targets are being met on a cost-effective basis
Ensures the production team has enough time to manufacture and deliver products based on the client's request
Creates a detailed schedule based on strict deadlines
Communicates any changes in the order or delivery date to relevant parties
Monitors production standards
Organises, plans, and implements inventory activity
Provides guidance to employees


Recruitment processes
Respond and send us your CV
Skype interview with Human Resource Team
Face to face interview with Manager
Job Type: Contract

jobs.title: Photographer
jobs.description:
Company description
The Iidoe Institute is a training program that defines professional experience.

We provide simulated programs that replicate a real life internal working environment with individuals working within different jobs, together, alongside each other and against each other.

The environment fosters a highly intensive gamified learning experience like no other, aimed at providing individuals with a complete professional experience facilitated by ground-breaking gamification technology and real time feedback. 

We are seeking hungry, enthusiastic, expressive individuals that are ready for a role that gives responsibility, experience and a large degree of autonomy. The main concept that runs throughout the Iidoe Institute, from faculty members to students, is creating strong independent minds that can come together and operate as a team.

We are looking for someone to fill the role as our Photographer:
Job duties

The daily responsibilities of a photographer vary, but typically include:
Working with clients to discuss the images they require and how they want to use them
Carrying out research and preparation for a shoot
Working in different locations and circumstances to get the right image
Using an extensive range of technical equipment, including cameras, lenses, lighting and specialist software
Communicating with photographic subjects, putting them at ease, encouraging them and directing them
Arranging still life objects, products, scenes, props and backgrounds
Liaising with other professionals, including graphic designers, writers, gallery managers, picture researchers, commissioning editors and art directors
Managing the processing and use of images, discussing technical problems, checking for quality and dealing with clients' concerns
Preparing proofs for approval

Job requirements
This job role requires candidates to be creative and fuelled by imagination, a good photographer must be able to look at something ordinary, or even extraordinary, and find a million different ways to interpret what he or she is seeing.

Recruitment processes
Respond and send us your CV.
Skype interview with Human Resource Team
Face to face interview with Manager
Job Type: Contract
